summary: This is an email correspondence from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York regarding the preparation and service of a subpoena to Bank of America for records related to the Epstein investigation. It includes instructions for routing the results to an FBI Special Agent and a Forensic Accountant.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, instructing the preparation and service of a subpoena to Bank of America for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Forensic Accountant
persons.context: A professional to be contacted with questions regarding the subpoena and to whom results should be forwarded, based at the FBI New York Field Office.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: An FBI agent to whom the subpoena results should be forwarded electronically, based in New York.

connections.description: The AUSA is coordinating the subpoena process and instructing that results be sent to the FBI Special Agent.
The AUSA lists the Forensic Accountant as a point of contact for questions regarding the subpoena.
Both are listed as points of contact for the subpoena and are part of the investigative team receiving the financial records.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance to Bank of America
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends instructions to prepare and serve a subpoena on Bank of America for records related to the Epstein investigation.

locations: FBI New York Field Office, NYC, NY 10278
keyFacts: A subpoena was issued to Bank of America on October 15, 2019, as part of the Epstein investigation.
The subpoena results were to be forwarded electronically to an FBI Special Agent and a Forensic Accountant in New York.
The document demonstrates active financial investigation by the Southern District of New York into Epstein's affairs after his death.
